meanings.definition: The amount that a barrel can hold.
meanings.sent1: He bought a barrelful of apples at the market.
meanings.sent2: The winery stored a barrelful of wine in the cellar.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a barrelful of water up the hill was quite a workout.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with a barrelful of laughter during the party.
meanings.sent5: The chef needed a barrelful of flour to bake all the bread for the event.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter inspected the barrelful of nails before starting the project.
meanings.sent2: The children played with a barrelful of marbles in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The pirate was disappointed to find a barrelful of sand instead of treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a barrelful of sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The magician pulled out a barrelful of colorful scarves from his hat.
